thread.title: Gold futures maintain losses after retail sales data
thread.title_full: Gold futures maintain losses after retail sales data - MarketWatch

author: William L. Watts
title: Gold futures maintain losses after retail sales data
text: Gold futures remained lower after July U.S. retail sales data was seen leaving the Federal Reserve on track to raise interest rates as early as September. The Commerce Department said retail sales rose 0.6% in July, just below the consensus forecast for a 0.7% rise, while sales for May and June were revised higher. December gold GCZ5, -0.61% fell back toward the previously established session low, losing $9.50, or 0.9%, to trade at $1,114.10 an ounce.
